definition: to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
a loner/someone who does not easily get along with others

sentences.english: You know your friends when you are in need.
Later, the two hunters schemed to capture the stranded crew of 90 Rebels.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，二人策劃俘獲落難的90名起義軍船員。

sentences.english: Where night-rack shrouds the Old Love fugitive.
sentences.chinese: 那爲暗夜所掩蓋的落難的舊愛。

sentences.english: The dogs were all but wiped out as their patrons in the last Qing Dynasty fell in 1911.
sentences.chinese: 隨着清朝1911年滅亡，京巴也隨主人命運而落難。

sentences.english: It is" a gust of wind to Ariel, pearl and difficult to clean".
sentences.chinese: 真是“一陣風來碧浪翻，珍珠零落難收拾”。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to die in battle (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
to resign a government post
client/customer
to be completely unrelated to one another (idiom)/irrelevant
pinyin: feng1 ma3 niu2 bu4 xiang1 ji2

definition: to set a trap
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
traitor
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation

political enemy/opponent
